title: (x) "Jagger" peculiar wide sans - Aspect {Akira}
content:
hi there  
does anyone know what font was used for this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121133228im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Picture-2_6420.gif)

thanks a lot

 [‹ (x) 09 soft tech sans - Platelet {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121133228/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50327 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Sans serif used for fashion credits in Elle magazine - Interstate {Tiff} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121133228/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50331 "Go to next forum topic")
author: agostini

comments.content:
[Aspect](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121133228/http:/www.typography.net/type/font/aspect) by [Jeremy Tankard](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121133228/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Jeremy%252BTankard)  
The E, the Q, and the R are alternate characters.

EDIT:  
Nope, see [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121133228/http:/www.typography.net/commissions/project/christchurch). Probably it’s this custom version of Aspect.

thanks akira!!  
it was the christchurch one!
